title: Authors and Citation
text: Arkadiusz Wiśniowski. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Wiśniowski (2023). MigMod: Integrated Modelling Human Migration. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://-wis.github.io/MigMod/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {MigMod: Integrated Modelling of Human Migration},   author = {Arkadiusz Wiśniowski},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://a-wis.github.io/MigMod/}, }

what: Bayesian integrated Modelling of (European) Migration via Stan
title: Integrated Modelling of Human Migration
text: R package estimates international migration flows using data sending receiving countries. uses Stan (via rstan package) back-end estimation. primary target audience students researchers like learn migration data producing synthetic migration data.

title: Integrated Modelling of Human Migration
text: package contains one key function migmod_m takes arguments data frame needed variables, sending receiving countries bilateral migration estimated years estimation required. data put data set mig_data. Dots ... denote arguments passed stan sampling function, number iterations, CPU cores used, etc. results can plotted using plot_migmod function converts stanfit posterior summaries, binds data plots using ggplot functions.
code: modfit <- migmod_m(df = mig_data,                    sending = c("SE", "FI", "IT", "PL"),                   receiving = c("SE", "FI", "IT", "PL"),                   years = 2010:2019,                   ref.country = "SE") plot_migmod(df = mig_data,              mmfit = modfit,             log.m = FALSE,             sending = c("SE", "FI", "IT", "PL"),             receiving = c("SE", "FI", "IT", "PL"),             years = 2010:2019)

what: Function transforming data frame to a list - input to Stan — data_2_standata
title: Function transforming data frame to a list - input to Stan — data_2_standata
text: Function transforming data frame list - input Stan

title: Function transforming data frame to a list - input to Stan — data_2_standata
code: data_2_standata(   df,   sending = c("SE", "FI", "IT", "PL"),   receiving = c("SE", "FI", "IT", "PL"),   years = 2010:2019,   ref.country = "SE" )

title: Function transforming data frame to a list - input to Stan — data_2_standata
text: df data frame migration data sending countries, receiving countries, data quality measures covariates sending vector ISO2 codes sending countries used model (recommended keep SE FI) receiving vector ISO2 codes receiving countries used model (recommended keep SE FI) years vector years used model (2010 2019) ref.country character ISO2 code receiving country immigration data used reference. assumes data reported country biased. assumption ensures identification model parameters. strongly recommended use Sweden ("SE") reference.

title: Function transforming data frame to a list - input to Stan — data_2_standata
text: list passed stan model contains required inputs

title: The 'MigMod' package. — MigMod-package
text: ESTIMATES BILATERAL MIGRATION FLOWS SELECTED EU COUNTRIES

title: The 'MigMod' package. — MigMod-package
text: Stan Development Team (NA). RStan: R interface Stan. R package version 2.26.13. https://mc-stan.org

what: Function to estimate migration model — migmod_m
title: Function to estimate migration model — migmod_m
text: model estimates 'true', unobserved bilateral migration flows \(y_{ijt}\) sending country \(\) receiving country \(j\) year \(t\). relies data reported receiving countries (immigration, \(z_{ijt}^R\)) sending countries (emigration, \(z_{ijt}^S\)). based methodology developed Raymer et al. (2013). data Poisson-distributed mean \(\mu_{ijt}^k\): \(z_{ijt}^k\sim\mathrm{Poisson}\left(\mu_{ijt}^k\right)\). true migration flows result correcting expected values data biases represented parameters \(\lambda\) different accuracies sending receiving countries' data \(\sigma\): \(\log\mu_{ijt}^k  \sim \mathrm{normal}\left(\log y_{ijt}+\lambda_{f(,j)}, \sigma_{g(,j)}^k\right)\). true flows modelled using mixed effects model contains autoregressive part parameter \(\phi\) gravity-type model populations sending (\(X_{}\)) receiving (\(X_{jt}\)) countries well distance \(D_{ij}\) : \(\log y_{ijt}^k  \sim \mathrm{normal}\left(\phi_{ij}\log y_{ijt-1} + \beta_1 X_{} + \beta_2 X_{jt} + \beta_3 D_{ij}, \sigma_y\right)\) Note, specification requires fully unobserved flows model.

title: Function to estimate migration model — migmod_m
code: migmod_m(   df,   sending = c("SE", "FI", "IT", "PL"),   receiving = c("SE", "FI", "IT", "PL"),   years = 2010:2019,   ref.country = "SE",   ... )

title: Function to estimate migration model — migmod_m
text: df data frame migration data sending countries, receiving countries, data quality measures covariates sending vector ISO2 codes sending countries used model (recommended keep SE FI) receiving vector ISO2 codes receiving countries used model (recommended keep SE FI) years vector years used model (2010 2019). ref.country character ISO2 code receiving country immigration data used reference. assumes data reported country biased. assumption ensures identification model parameters. strongly recommended use Sweden ("SE") reference. ... Arguments passed function sampling package rstan (e.g. iter, chains).

title: Function to estimate migration model — migmod_m
text: object class stanfit returned rstan::sampling

title: Function to estimate migration model — migmod_m
text: Raymer J., Wiśniowski ., Forster J. J., Smith P. W. & Bijak J. (2013). Integrated modeling European migration. Journal American Statistical Association, 108(503), 801-819. https://doi.org/10.1080/01621459.2013.789435.

title: Eurostat migration data — mig_data
text: data sets downloaded : publicly available Eurostat data base population: https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/main/data/database, data bases 'migr' 'demo'. migration statistics selected EU countries, population sizes. data relate 2010-2019 period. Shiny app made Maciej Jan Dańko: https://maciej-jan-danko.shinyapps.io/HMigD_Shiny_App_I/, data contain assumed accuracy data sources. Shiny app made Maciej Jan Dańko: https://maciej-jan-danko.shinyapps.io/undercountmigscores/ data contain undercounting scores emigration immigration based 30% metadata 70% model scores. Data distance countries CEPII database cepii.fr/CEPII/.

title: Eurostat migration data — mig_data
text: tibble two variables three observations

title: Eurostat migration data — mig_data
text: mig_data data frame/tibble.

what: Function to plot synthetic migration estimates — plot_migmod
title: Function to plot synthetic migration estimates — plot_migmod
text: Function plot synthetic migration estimates

title: Function to plot synthetic migration estimates — plot_migmod
code: plot_migmod(   df,   mmfit,   log.m = FALSE,   sending = c("SE", "FI", "IT", "PL"),   receiving = c("SE", "FI", "IT", "PL"),   years = 2010:2019 )

title: Function to plot synthetic migration estimates — plot_migmod
text: df data frame migration data sending countries, receiving countries, data quality measures covariates mmfit stanfit object produced function migmod_m contains estimates model parameters synthetic estimates "true" migration. log.m Logical (FALSE default). function produces plot estimates level-scale. Setting option TRUE produce results log scale. sending vector ISO2 codes sending countries used model (recommended keep SE FI) receiving vector ISO2 codes receiving countries used model (recommended keep SE FI) years vector years used model (2010 2019)

title: Function to plot synthetic migration estimates — plot_migmod
text: object class ggplot.
